tool_description: Generates a collection of customer satisfaction questions based on specified categories, ensuring variety in question types and covering different aspects of the customer experience.

questions_per_category.description: Number of questions to generate per category (1-20)

question_complexity.description: Complexity level: simple, moderate, or advanced

industry_focus.description: Industry context for questions: retail, healthcare, technology, financial, hospitality, or general

avoid_leading_questions.description: Whether to avoid potentially leading or biased questions

language_tone.description: Tone for questions: casual, professional, or formal

error_messages: Invalid question categories: Use categories like [overall_satisfaction, product_quality, customer_service, value_for_money, recommendation_likelihood, website_experience, staff_behavior, wait_time, problem_resolution, brand_trust].
Questions per category out of range: Value must be between 1 and 20.
Invalid complexity level: Use one of [simple, moderate, advanced].
Invalid industry focus: Use one of [retail, healthcare, technology, financial, hospitality, general].
Invalid language tone: Use one of [casual, professional, formal].
Empty question categories: Provide at least one category.
usage: Specify question_categories, questions_per_category, question_complexity, and industry_focus. Optionally configure avoid_leading_questions, include_open_ended, and language_tone. The tool returns a structured question bank with metadata.

questions_by_category.description: List of all generated questions with category labels

question_types.description: Types of questions included (multiple_choice, likert, rating, open_ended)

recommended_scales.description: Recommended rating scales for each question type
